thread.title: Packers QB Jordan Love Lends Help After Car Gets Stuck In Snow

title: Packers QB Jordan Love Lends Help After Car Gets Stuck In Snow
text:
Packers QB Jordan Love Lends Help After Car Gets Stuck In Snow
Jan 13, 2024, 3:07 PM
SALT LAKE CITY ‚Äì Former
Utah State Aggies and current Green Bay Packers quarterback Jordan Love gave a helping hand to a young woman after her car was stuck in a snow drift.
Jordan Love Offers Help After Car Gets Stuck
Love‚Äôs good deed was shared after
@AllieKurowski shared a photo of the NFL quarterback via a post on X on January 12. RELATED: How To Watch Local Players, Coaches In Super Wild Card Weekend
‚ÄúOmg Jordan Love helping my niece out of a snow drift‚Ä¶what can‚Äôt he do? That‚Äôs my qb,‚Äù the photo was captioned.
QB1 is always ready to help ‚ù§Ô∏è (via
[@AllieKurowski]) [@jordan3love]| [@packers] [pic.twitter.com/mjH9XAJZZW]
‚Äî NFL (@NFL)
[January 12, 2024]
Lucy Kurowski, the 20-yard-old driver, shared her experience with Love in an
interview with FOX 11‚Äôs Michelle Melby. According to the interview, Kurowski was leaving an appointment and realized her car was stuck on the snowy ground.
‚ÄúI get in my car and I‚Äôm stuck. Like, I can‚Äôt back out. I can‚Äôt move forward,‚Äù Kurowski told Melby.
Kurowski explained that she saw Love walking past but didn‚Äôt want to bother him. Before driving away Love noticed that the car was stuck and pulled up to Kurowski‚Äôs vehicle to ask if she needed help.
NFL quarterback by day, Good Samaritan by night! Green Bay
[#Packers]‚Äò Jordan Love ( [@jordan3love]) is getting lots of attention on social media for helping a young woman whose car got stuck in [#WSBennett]. Watch FOX 11 News at Nine for an exclusive interview:
‚Äî WLUK-TV FOX 11 (@fox11news)
[January 13, 2024]
‚ÄúI did a double take, and then I did a triple take. We made eye contact a few times but he was getting in his car, I didn‚Äôt want to bother him.‚Äù Kurowski continued her story. ‚ÄúHe gets out of his car and he‚Äôs like, ‚ÄòAre you okay?‚Äô And I was like, ‚ÄòAre you Jordan Love?!‚Äô I was fangirling.‚Äù
Unfortunately, Love and Kurowski weren‚Äôt successful in moving the vehicle on their own.
Despite the unfortunate circumstance with her car, Kurowski said it was a memorable experience. She took a photo with Love before sharing it with her family and posting it to social media.
‚ÄúI couldn‚Äôt even believe it. It didn‚Äôt feel real. I was in a state of shock,‚Äù Kurowski explained to FOX 11. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs blowing up and I think everyone is truly seeing that he‚Äôs not just an MVP on the field, but just a great, great person. He‚Äôs a great representation of what Green Bay is.‚Äù
Love and the Packers finished the regular season with a 9-8 record. Green Bay clinched a playoff berth and will face the Dallas Cowboys during Super Wild Card Weekend. The Cowboys will host the Packers on Sunday, January 14 at 2:30 p.m. (MT) on FOX.
.
[@jordan3love]‚Äòs strong afternoon continues as he throws his second touchdown pass of the game and 32nd this season. [#LocalsInTheNFL] [#NFL] [#GoPackGo] [#CHIvsGB] [#AggiesAllTheWay] [@kslsports] [pic.twitter.com/sKjyRVmRdK]
‚Äî Kyle Ireland (@kyleireland)
[January 7, 2024]
About Jordan Love
Before his time in the league, the Bakersfield, California native played at USU from 2016-19. During his time with the Aggies, Love threw for 8,600 yards, 60 touchdowns, and 29 interceptions with a completion rate of 61 percent.
In 2020, the Packers traded up to select Love with the No. 26 overall pick in the NFL Draft.
During his rookie campaign, the former USU standout was inactive for each of Green Bay‚Äôs games.
.
[@jordan3love]is dealing right now. üî•
The former Aggie is up to four total touchdowns tonight, including three passing.
üì∫:
[@KSL5TV] [#LocalsInTheNFL] [#NFL] [#SNF] [#GBvsMIN] [#GoPackGo] [#AggiesAllTheWay] [@kslsports] [pic.twitter.com/vZviShkYe0]
‚Äî Kyle Ireland (@kyleireland)
[January 1, 2024]
Love saw limited action in his second and third seasons with the Packers and continued to serve as the backup to four-time NFL MVP Aaron Rodgers. Following the 2022 season, the Packers traded Rodgers to the New York Jets. The Rodgers trade paved the way for Love to be Green Bay‚Äôs QB1 in 2023.
In his first three seasons, Love threw for 606 yards, three touchdowns, and three interceptions with a 60.2 percent completion rate in 10 games played.
As a starter in 2023, the former Utah State quarterback threw for 4,159 yards, 32 touchdowns, and 11 interceptions with a completion rate of 64.2 percent. Love also ran for four touchdowns.
